title: Ball State coach Chevis Jackson 2017 MAC Recruiter of the Year
text:
Manage Ball State coach Chevis Jackson 2017 MAC Recruiter of the Year Chevis Jackson led the charge for Ball State in the state of Georgia as the 31-year old LSU grad helped sign eight from the Peach State. Slot to 247Sports Links 
Ball State defensive backs coach Chevis Jackson is a rising star on the recruiting trail as he takes home 247Sports’s Mid-American Conference Recruiter of the Year for the 2017 cycle. 
The 31-year old Jackson was instrumental in the Cardinals rise to No. 2 in the MAC recruiting rankings as the LSU grad out of Mobile, Ala. went into SEC country and led Ball State’s charge in the Peach State, working as the primary on eight that signed from the state of Georgia. 
Class headliners in receivers Khalil Newton and Justin Gibbs along with athlete Justin Hall and cornerback Verenzo Holmes were all recruited by Jackson, four of the nine three-stars Mike Neu and company brought in 2017, their first full year recruiting as a staff. 
"He's a great person," Holmes said of Jackson. "It's feel like you're talking to a brother when you're talking to him. He's just everything you look for in a coach! Amazing person. Great and fun personality! Doesn't get no better than Coach Jackson." 
Ball State wanted to add a lot more team speed with this haul and they did that with Jackson paving the way. 
This is Jackson’s first on-field coaching job after working as a graduate assistant at South Alabama and then LSU. 
Jackson helped lead LSU to a National Championship in 2007 before going on to be drafted in the third round of the NFL Draft by the Atlanta Falcons. He played four years with five different teams before finding his way to coaching.
